org.mule.api.config
Interface ThreadingProfile

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChainedThreadingProfile, ImmutableThreadingProfile
public interface ThreadingProfile

Mule uses a few different pools i.e. for service threads and message dispatchers. This interface makes it easier to configure the pool. Pools are created via ImmutableThreadingProfile.createPool(String, ThreadingProfile) (which should really be a separate factory).

ImmutableThreadingProfile is a simple read-only implementation that makes a local copy of any ThreadingProfile passed to a consructor.

ChainedThreadingProfile is a mutable implementation that can take default values from an existing ThreadingProfile. The default values can be either dynamic (read whenever the value is queried) or static (a local copy of the default is made when the profile is first constructed).
